channel.title: Problem
channel.description:
For some reason I can only access my server, or any other server there is if I have an active internet connection. The computer which I use for my server does not have Internet, but I've tried on [b]Several[/b] different computers, such as putting my server on a blank CD, and transfering it that way. Do you really have to have Internet to have, or connect to a server? Thanks.
P.S: I am trying to connect to my server using [b]127.0.0.1[/b] Localhost IP, but it doesn't work. Help?

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @Lord_of_fallen_Angel Lord of fallen Angels
item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

Well, the client never connects through with the server, and I have tried Several, maybe up to 6 DIFFERENT Clients. The Server’s Logger (run.bat), doesn’t even say: “Connection recieved from: 127.0.0.1”, so the client is connecting to my Server, it’s just it can’t find the IP which the server is running off of. Please help.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

127.0.0.1 should work. Is it even running? (The server.)

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

'Alec, I suggest you learn when it’s appropriate to retaliate. ^

@Lord of fallen Angels: You do not need an active internet connection to connect to your own server.

Read full topic
